inclusion.criterion: History of NYHA (New York Heart Association) Class III or IV congestive heart failure
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Has symptomatic, decompensated CHF for which inpatient therapy with either dobutamine or Natrecor®, administered as a single intravenous vasoactive agent (drugs that influence the tone and caliber of blood vessels) with or without diuretics, is deemed appropriate
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Receiving stable doses of oral antiarrhythmic medications (medications that help regulate irregular heart beats) for at least the 48 hours before starting study drug, or receiving no antiarrhythmic medications
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Cannot tolerate a 24-Hour Baseline Holter Monitoring Period without intravenous vasoactive medications, and/or cannot tolerate the specified washout period (if applicable) of intravenous vasoactive medications before starting the baseline Holter monitoring
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Has systolic blood pressure consistently < 85 mm Hg, cardiogenic shock, or other evidence of significant hemodynamic instability requiring the immediate institution of inotropic/pressor support
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Has a clinical condition expected to require therapy with more than one intravenous vasoactive agent or Dopamine during the 24-Hour Treatment Holter Monitoring Period
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Has received treatment with Dopamine or any intravenous vasoactive medication such as Dobutamine, Milrinone, Nitroprusside or intravenous Nitroglycerin for more than 4 hours for the current episode of decompensated CHF or related illness
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Requires an intravenous antiarrhythmic medication during the 48 hours before starting the study
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has multifactorial chronic hypoxemia and dyspnea thought due to diastolic CHF, pulmonary hypertension thought secondary to a chronic ASD and COPD on 5L home oxygen. Cardiology consult recommended a right heart cath for evaluation of response to sildenafil but the patient refused.
